it could be 9005 which could be an AWS Network or it could be um you know every

networks now the primary only has a metric of one because
we're only going through the one as path so we're sourcing from uh 65001 instead

the um the primary path that has one as path okay
all righty so if we talk about an active active deployment if you do send us two

something we support on a direct connect link and BFD is basically a mechanism for uh speeding up the failover of a
routing protocol like bgp or OPF so bgp and OPF for example have hello times or
keep alive times and hold times and with bgp you can adjust those timers so that
you can have um you probably don't want to go lower than maybe 3C keep alive and a 9-second hold time which means it
takes 9 seconds to fail over for a BG GP so if bgp goes down so you've got to had
a link that's gone down bgp will go down you'll wait the 9 seconds then bgp will say hey I'm not getting any keep alive
packets from my partner from my from my neighbor I'm going to fail over to another link or I'm going to remove that
route from the the rib or the routing information base or the routing table of the router um if we have BFD here we've
got 300 and 300 multier 3 that's 300 milliseconds so BFD will detect the
failure in 900 milliseconds so 3 times the 300 00 milliseconds interval so you could potentially fail over in 900
milliseconds because what BFD does is it will go into the routing table and pull out the bgp route within 900
milliseconds when it's configured on the interface and also on the uh on the routing protocol so BFD is very handy
